cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to resume northward later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north through the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turn northeast across the Southeast U.S. and accelerate toward the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the Mid-Atlantic; current watches limited to western Cuba and the Yucatan coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and the Isle of Youth, and from Tulum to Cabo Catoche (including Cozumel) in Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from the eastern Yucatan to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across GA/SC/NC and the Mid-Atlantic coast (VA–NJ, including DE)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (2-4 in. widespread, isolated higher amounts)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (minor surge of 1-3 ft possible in Delaware Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35-45 mph) possible late Thu night–Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding in Delaware Bay and tidal portions of the Christina River
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Thu–Fri could produce 2-4 in. with locally higher totals, leading to urban/river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes embedded in outer rain bands late Thu–Fri
